DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study characterize normal brain function premature infant ( 23 31+6 week GA ) birth transition first 72 hour life .
DOC.brief_title: The Neu-Prem Trial : Neuromonitoring Preterm Newborn Brain During Birth Resuscitation
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator measure component brain function use two sophisticated , non-invasive technology . First , amplitude integrated electroencephalography ( EEG ) , `` simplify '' EEG four sensor ( single channel ) , enable continuous non-invasive monitoring cerebral activity . Second , near-infrared spectroscopy ( NIRS ) another non-invasive technology allow continuous real-time measurement regional tissue oxygen utilization brain . Both technology use newborn predictive brain injury neurodevelopmental impairment .
DOC.criteria: 23 31+6 week gestational age birth Known congenital anomaly Parents refuse consent Neonatologist decline due subject instability
